Again I would've tried this but we had other things to do...If you're very flexible with your travelling plan on being there for a Wednesday afternoon/evening as they have a farmer's market type of street fair which closes off a portion of Newport Ave. Very walking distance for a 2.5 year old...there was even an inflatable jumper thingy for free that gave us a break. Ample restaurants and bars to keep a variety of ages entertained. We ate at a Mexican restaurant on the north side (forgot name), but had gotten very full eating and sampling foods along the street. It did provide for breakfast the next morning, which worked out very well with the micro and frig. I urged my wife to take our son for a walk along the beach (about .7? mile each way to the far breakwater) I needed to plan the day’s activities so unfortunately I did not make the morning walk (this was a Thursday morning and no weekend crowds if there are any?). Cleanliness gave it a 4 since I always wear flip-flops in any room I book, but that room did appear clean. Service I gave it a 2 since I did not use any besides checking in and checking out, nor did I use the maid service. I did make my reservations over the phone (as I knew I wanted to book this special room not available over the net booking) and did not have any problems. Rooms was a 4 since I was unable to rate other rooms. Location a 5 for the beach across the street / above average pier even compared to Newport and Huntington beach / short walk to bars, restaurants, convenience store for supplies, and Wednesday street event / And last but not least is the sound of the soothing ocean sounds!...relaxing and priceless! If you expect your full money value to be in the room alone you might be a little disappointed, but overall value is there. Would have liked to's: Walk to the end of the southern part of beach to see tide pools at low tide. Fished of the pier. Eaten and had drinks at the pier diner (no rating on food sorry). Explored more of the general area for other hidden gems or hotspots. And last but not least is too sleep with the French doors open to fall asleep and wake to the sounds of the ocean (Didn't do this due to temperature and unknown bug/mosquito problems for my son). It has been a pleasure to share this with the world...hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: findcate
Reviews.Content: I think the location of the hotel is very special. It is right on the beach. The room itself feels like it needs a serious update. The room is very 70s, and the bathroom feels like an unclean and outdated lockerroom. Despite that, the location is great, nice to be able to walk step on a very beautiful & quiet beach. It wasn't perfect but the location is amazing & it was a good deal overall for a beachfront hotel in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....but...”
Reviews.Author: chutchi
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location...It is wonderful from that perspective. The rooms are clean and the beds comfy. But, there were a few issues.....the toilet paper was so bad that I ended up buying my own at the local store. The phone didn't work, and whoever did the renovations was obviously a novice. The thing that bugged me the most was that the shower didn't drain, and when I asked management to do something about it, they did nothing. So, while I liked the place, I wouldn't pay the price for a room that had too many issues-despite the fabulous view.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: snappyrivera2
Reviews.Content: We spend Sunday evening at the OB hotel and brought our puppy. Room and bathroom was clean but very small. We stayed in a room with a patio. The remote to the TV was not working so i had to get up to change the chanel ever so often. On the positive side, this hotel has a great location. Its walking distance to various retaurants and shops. They have coffee in the morning at the reception area for guests but do not offer breakfast. They have a very good rate and do not charge extra if you bring your pet.

Reviews.Title: “blissful magic :)”
Reviews.Author: jessiemayridelove
Reviews.Content: i had the most inspiring stay at the ocean beach hotel. i found it after one painful night at the holiday inn(on sports arena blvd- which feels like it could be anywhere in the states- as it had every chain on the highway surrounding it- and a room facing onto a parking lot) it was a depressing entry into sunny san diego which i was longing to visit and experience. i went to the beach after one night at the holiday inn- knowing that as soon as i found the ocean, my inspiration for what to do would come to me... i felt revived as soon as i hit ocean beach and the moment i turned around - there it was... the ocean beach hotel- smiling in all of its radiant glory right back at me... and i did not hesitate for a moment - i went to reception and booked the last room with an oceanview & cozy balcony(for the most majestic sunsets i've seen- and i've travelled everywhere!!)... i also asked an older lovely couple who were about to check in about the rooms and they shared that they had been loyal ocean beach hotel guests and looked forward to their time there every year!!! the fluid inspiration was so alive, and there was no looking back!!! i spent a week there- and it felt like home! the staff were warm, the rooms were clean and full of soul & charm... the balcony was my favorite - as i would delight in having my dinner while soaking in the golden sunsets... . not to mention the blissful location... right at the ocean end of newport street(a delicious street flowing with smiling faces, bikes, dogs, surfers, families - and a wonderful array of yummy food options from authentic mexican- to organic & healthy little nooks, to funky surfer burger joints... and lots of precious little shops & treasures along the beach vibey strip(lined with palm trees) all flowing into the stunning beach & ocean vista. ocean beach hotel was a big part of my love affair with san diego- and i couldn't have imagined staying anywhere else!!! a true gem, in paradise!!!!!! i will be back again soon.... :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach find”
Reviews.Author: WorldAz
Reviews.Content: During a recent trip to San Diego from AZ my girlfriend and I were lucky enough to find this gem of a hotel in a great little beach town. We were greeted by a very friendly staff and even told we get free wi fi no charge. While our room was not big, it was very clean The court yard is beautiful and very soothing with a fountain to sip your morning coffee and just watch the ocean.. Everything is just a walk away including shops and restaurants, so we never even used our car. It is located right by a pier and 4 long beaches. My only complaint is there is no roof top bar to .enjoy the great sunsets. We did have to walk 10 whole feet next door to find that. If you love the beach, and long for life as it should be, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Special Moments in a Special Place”
Reviews.Author: kernmeister1
Reviews.Content: We can not say enough of how special our time here was. We were fortunate to have the upstairs condo overlooking the beach on the evening we were engaged. Ocean beach is such a special place and the OB Hotel is the shining jewel. We got engaged on Sept 27, 2008, during a walk along the beach and onto the rocks they called "Sunset Cliffs". My fiance then surprised me with a condo type room overlooking the beach with all of the amenities of home and more. What a neat little town away from the hustle and bustle an one very special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you need to read this before you book”
Reviews.Author: sunnyinaz
Reviews.Content: PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE YOU BOOK- We made reservations to stay at this hotel Sept 26-28, 2008. We had a sudden death in the family & couldn't travel. I called them to explain the situation. The front desk attendent said he would have to check with his manager in the AM but said he was sure we wouldn't be charged due to the circumstances. I requested that the manager call me & left two numbers for him I checked with Amex on Saturday & they ran my card. I tried several times to contact the manager but he never returned my call. Everytime I called I was sweet talked & told how he was not avoiding me. They took my numbers again assuring me of a return call. He never called back.. The last time I called I was told by the front desk clerk that the manager said it was too bad about our loss but we were being charged. So much for being so understanding & friendly! Not even a return call. Beware. Stay any place else!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and amazing OCEAN VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: four411
Reviews.Content: Ocean Beach Hotel: Is exactly what it is advertised as....Ocean Beach Hotel. Amazing views of the ocean. Very nice rooms, excellent hotel customer service. Perfect hotel for anyone who enjoys the living on the beach lifestyle. Easy access to the beach, awesome restaurants and bars in walking distance. This hotel unlike others have excellent free WIFI for hotel guests. This is must stay hotel if your in the SAN DIEGO area or if your going to want to stay close to SEAWORLD. Awesome beach community, hotel is very well located. Have fun!!! and Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Motel/ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alestar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my family of 5 (2 adults, 3 kids) This hotel is 1 step above a cheap Motel. The name should really be "The Ocean Beach Inn" The one & only attraction is the closeness to the beach. The carpet was filthy & unpleasantly moist. The shower tile is falling apart, the walls had cracks in them. There was 1 window in our room & it did not have a screen. The courtyard is nice, but could use some gardening maintenance (it's like a little maze with cracked stepping stones) There is a shower for you to rinse off before going into your room, which made it nice. The pier is right across the street, but there's not much to do there. There is lots of night life on Newport Ave. I would not stay there again. I could not sleep & the bed felt itchy. take a shower w/sandals on. The TV stand was falling apart in pieces. The only piece that looked it was from this century was the A/C unit. Definitely not for kids. If you are looking for a Motel this is a good choice. Not a Hotel in the least!

Reviews.Title: “Best 4th of July EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobglaser2
Reviews.Content: What a day, what a night. We went on the 4th of July to enjoy the beach and the fireworks. The hotel is feet from the beach and was great. Our room was right near the ocean side and we could have watched the fireworks from our front door. But we went to the beach instead. Outside our door was a quiet courtyard to relax and enjoy our morning coffee. The room was sharp and clean and the staff was ready to help with any request. Nearby shopping with local artists was a blast and there are great bars and resturants in all directions!! We will be back many times. This place is the bomb!!! Bob

Reviews.Title: “in front of the beach”
Reviews.Author: gg309
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel where I spent 4 nights and where you can have rooms with views on Ocean Beach. Everyone is friendly and you can borrow boards at the front desk, who was very helpful. There is a small patio where tou can have lunch or breakfast, that is really nice. Just outside the patio you get in front of the beach, the location is great! Moreover, the hotel provides a free wifi internet access that works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorMember12
Reviews.Content: Horrible! We ended up here because everything else in San Diego was booked for Comic-Con. When we arrived at the front desk the girl couldn't find our reservation. She told us there was nothing on file and all of her rooms were fully booked. When I handed her my confirmation receipt from Travelocity she proudly announced (after much squinting and at the computer screen) that we were in the system after all. When we got up to our room on the second floor I seriously contemplated sleeping in the car. The carpet was old, stained and scary. The room smelled like a combination of mildew and urine. (The smell hits you as soon as you open the door) The sheets were clean but the comforter was stained and disgusting. The furniture was filthy and the bathroom was small and cramped. (This coming from someone who lives in the city. I'm used to small bathrooms) The shower was crumbling and smelly. I suggest wearing your flip-flops at all times. Bottom line: Free parking and great location next to the beach. Perfect for a group of young people looking to party. I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for clean quiet accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Are you ready to party?!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheCollectedTraveler
Reviews.Content: Better be if you're planning a stay at the OB Hotel... From the noise levels to the musty bathroom, this place brings back fond memories of college. To be fair, though, one has to anticipate that certain type of energy from this place, located steps from the shore in the heart of San Diego's surfer-dude village. My boyfriend and I checked in on a Friday in July, not expecting the Ritz based on reputation, but hopeful that the very-friendly, helpful staff was a positive indicator that the facility might just surprise us in a fun, carefree San Diego kind of way. Nope. We arrived at our third-floor room and our jaws hit the floor when the stink hit our nostrils: eau de must, mold and cigarettes (in a non-smoking room). The bathroom was a stall-sized cell containing a stand-up shower (wear your flip-flops), toilet, sink (upon which one could rest their chin while enjoying a session, if one felt so inclined), as well as the most sinister-looking dust bunny ever seen peering down from the ventilation fan (see photo, though it does not do justice). The carpet was scary (wear your flip-flops). The a/c was portable, and though we could technically see the ocean from our awkward screen-free window, we could also see the back of a crummy condo, ample bird pollution, broken furniture, and two thankfully retired commodes (see photo, this one does do justice). The real fun started at 3am when the frat boys arrived to their room next door, though it could have just as easily been our room, since the walls are simply a formality possibly formed by wall paper over, evidently, nothing. "Who's up for beer pong?!" Not us. Though we were up. For the next six hours. Until we checked out after deciding that our fun, carefree, blissful vacation would be better spent in a hotel with not as much “cool,” a little more quiet, and a lot less chance of catching staph. Bottom line, since you were likely wondering when I'd finally get to it: Great staff. Cute courtyard. Fantastic location. Hooray for free parking. Not for those who enjoy basking in the peaceful company of their special someone. Perfect for that 36-hour bender or those who like knowing exactly what their neighbors are smoking.

Reviews.Title: “um, wasn't terrible”
Reviews.Author: capoxoxxo
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the first floor just as you exit to the beach. We had a dog with us so I believe we had to have a first floor room. The room itself was not horrible, sheets were clean, semi clean floor , but it is sandy everywhere, it was not updated at all. The bathroom however had a big hole in the wall and kind of gross. We left the window open and that helped. It really needed some work. The area I thought was colorful. Everyone we met was nice and the resturants were good. We were very happy to see how pet friendly the hotel and entire area was. They had an off leash dog beach down the street (5min drive) and the beach across from the hotel allowed leashed dogs at posted times of the day. There are all kinds of people around and all ages, I felt pretty safe at the hotel and outside. People hung out and played music on the street. The one thing I really did not like though was that the doors on the back of the hotel are supposed to lock when you go out and they need to be replaced because they do not lock unless you slam them. Meaning anyone can just walk in. We really liked San Diego and Ob is a fun place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RAlexH79
Reviews.Content: I go down to Ocean Beach two times a year at least and always stay at the Ocean Beach Hotel. First off the hotel is in the perfect location, directly across the street from the beach. Also it is pet friendly because of Dog Beach which is also very close. Most if not all of the rooms on the south and west side of the hotel at least have a view of the beach if not a balcony complete with chairs and a table. The only drawback to the hotel that i could see is that the rooms are fairly small (they cant hold much more than three people comfortably). Other than that some people may or may not like the fact that there are quite a few bars up the street but i personally think its funny to watch people acting crazy from a third floor balcony. One last benefit of the OB Hotel is that along with all the bars there are a few very good restaurants just up the street and a few around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “An experience we'll never forget!”
Reviews.Author: metawillhite
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at Ocean Beach Hotel. We planned on staying only one night, then ship off to another spot and so forth. After that first night, we decided that the cozy romantic views of the courtyard and the ocean were something we had to enjoy 6 days longer! The staff were very helpful and made sure we were taken care of. There were plenty of homegrown businesses in walking distance which made it easy to find a good cooked meal! (we support family/local companies!) To top it off, It was so nice to come home to a room that is already cleaned with fresh towels! It's the little things that count!! We plan on spending our 1 year anniversary at Ocean Beach and can't wait to lay in their soft beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “Was ok”
Reviews.Author: mulemobile
Reviews.Content: Needs to get coffee machines in the rooms. New carpet would be nice. Great staff. Awesome views and location is fantastic. Great hotel for pets. Dog park close by. However, the homeless and drug peddlers on the boadwalk takes away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax and enjoy OB, for us AND our dogs!”
Reviews.Author: freeamanda
Reviews.Content: Ocean Beach Hotel was a great launching pad for me, my boyfriend, AND our dogs to enjoy OB. We actually enjoyed being AT the hotel too, thanks to the nice courtyard. We met friends and hung out in the courtyard under the sun more than once! Our room was on the corner at the beach, a fluke but probably the best room in the place. The hotel lets folks with dogs book rooms on the ground floor only, which is what I wanted anyway - that way the courtyard (sunny, teeming with blooming jasmine, comfy tables, fountains) and the ocean view were right there! The room was very nice- simple, but clean, comfortable, and with tiled floors to deal with the inevitable sand issue. We walked everywhere around OB for the four days we stayed- out the pier to relax, to music, beers, etc. I will definitely return to OB Hotel, and next time with my beach cruiser in tow! A note to dog owners, the beach across the road is not for dogs from 9-6, but Dog Beach is about five blocks away and HUGE. So there's plenty of places to exercise the pooches. My only complaints were about a) the patio- which was potentially cute but currently boring-it needed some plants or something, and even the little fountain wasn't working; b) the bathroom needed some more towel racks and hooks, and c) the staff was at times less than responsive. A small example: we had our own coffee grounds and filters (we were on a road trip!) and all we needed was hot water for great coffee. When i asked about hot water, all I got was the blankest of stares. Luckily, there are great coffee shope all around, but it still boggled my mind that there was NO access to hot water in the lobby, though there was coffee (bad coffee, but still) offered in the lobby! At other times the staff was great, but it was a little inconsistent. Overall though, it was a great hotel and that part of town is tons of fun- highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Doddie Paradise”
Reviews.Author: snobabe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there multiple times and when you travel with dogs to the beach you don't expect the Ritz or you don't have fun! we love it here and so does Badgley, our Greyhound who loves to socialize at the hotel and at the beach. Highly recommended for the dog lover in you.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: asondreal
Reviews.Content: Nice little place right on the beach. Room and bathroom are very small, but clean. Ocean Beach is a young, late-night loving crowd. People were coming and going all day/night and with the walls being very thin, it was easy to hear conversations and doors opening/closing. If you plan to go to bed before 1am on the weekend, I strongly recommend bringing earplugs. The hotel is at the end of the street that’s lined with a bunch of funky stores, restaurants and bars, so there is always some place to grab a bite or drink at almost any time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a romantic get away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HolyRoller11
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous after reading the reviews on this website, however I am VERY glad I choose to go any way. It is very clean, very friendly, and who can forget right next to the beach! The rooms were small, however very clean and served its purpose. The town was very cool, just a classic beach town. I loved the Mexican food right next to the hotel. My hubby and I will be making this a future destination.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funky”
Reviews.Author: urbanrenewal
Reviews.Content: This was a fun, nice place to stay in a great location. A little pricey for what you got. Timid travellers might be scared off by the colorful characters on the street below. If you go there, head right over to the fishing pier and have a GREAT fish taco in the little restaurant. The fishing pier is an interesting scene also with people of many languages and colors united by a common love of fishing. A few people looked as if they wouldn't be eating if they didn't catch something, Others were enjoying a family outing. Our room was just adequate -- and we had the second best room in the place. You have to close the sliding doors to the balcony if you want to sleep, as it's a noisy location, but they block out most street noise. The hotel courtyard is very pretty, day and night. There are dog rooms but barking was not a problem. You sometimes get a whiff of cigarette smoke if someone is smoking on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Noisy and very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: azturbomini
Reviews.Content: This hotel or "Motel" has a great location and that is where the great stops. The walls in the rooms are very thin and we could actually over hear conversations from the other rooms on each side of us. Going to sleep and staying asleep was hard for all of us. Our room was on the top floor and we had to make sure we walked softly so not to disturb our guest below due to the floors being old and weak. The room size was also very small so if you have more than 2 persons per room you will be cramped. What furniture we had in the room was old as was the carpet. The bathroom was small and had rust stains in the sink and bathtub. Its really to bad that they don’t do a total remodel because the hotel sits on a great piece of land right by a decent beach. If you are used to staying at decent hotels (Marriott, Hilton etc...) for work or pleasure, you will be sorely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: time2travelPhoenix
Reviews.Content: First I want to say that the location on ocean beach is terrific. I personally prefer mission beach area now being to them both since I think it is much cleaner and a lot more to do but if you like ocean beach you cannot beat the location. With that being said I was very disappointed with the hotel. For the price of $250 and night our room was not very nice. The airconditioner did not work well and we had the smallest bathroom space. Also although it had two beds the beds were very cramped in the room with a partial wall split, The area at night had many problems with the homeless population and we felt unsafe walking around at night with the kids. I suspect the high rate was for the ability to walk directly to the ocean and some of the rooms had an ocean views. Ours was sparsely considered a view. On the positive note the staff was very friendly and the places to eat in walking distance were amazing! I guess if I had paid in the low to mid $100 a night it would have been worth it but with no pool, no hot tub, no luxury so to speak it was a little to pricey for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: frenzi
Reviews.Content: We (Psychiatrist,55 psychologist,63)stayed for 9 days visiting the APA Conference in San Diego. Being from Amsterdam it is difficult to feel at home in a dull City like San Diego. But The Ocean Beach was really fine. The staff was helpful, the rooms were clean and OK, the price was good. The neighbourhood of the OB is nice, wooden houses, antiqueshops, a beautiful pier with a cafe where you can see dolphins and seals while having your breakfast, also jugglers and hippies making music. In the reviews I read they were called "vagrants". Well, I have never felt unsafe. There is enough police around.If you want to be in a dull and ugly San Diego Hotel, go the Marriott and enjoy yourself! If I ever go back to San Diego I will come back here. Distance to the city is only 20 minutes and you are at a wonderful seaside in sixties-style. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: ccgalg
Reviews.Content: First off, I guess I just didn't know how crappy the town of Ocean Beach is. That may have saved me from paying over $200/ night on the OB Hotel. The room was extremely small. So small it didn't/ couldn't have a desk. The bathroom was so small it didn't/ couldn't have a tub. Bed was awful. TV was tiny - maybe a 19". No breakfast. Walls were thin and my wife was terrified to walk outside the hotel by herself at night because the area is filled with drunks and vagrants. Bottom line - STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “My 1 Year Wedding Anniversary Trip Ruined!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkblossom
Reviews.Content: We original booked the Sheraton hotel but I told my husband that I wanted a beautiful beach view, what I got from OB Beach hotel was basically a hole in the wall for more than what I would of payed at the beautiful Sheraton. The beds were horrible. Our sheets were shredded and you will find homeless people everywhere drunk and walking around the hotel. 100% Unsafe, Unclean, and Expensive. I would die before I recommend this hole in the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: spinspinnsuga
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my spring break, and honestly, it was a great stay. The front desk is friendly and attentive, maid service on time every single day; the courtyard is beautiful with a great view of the ocean. Everything was clean and neat and it had a laundry room and free wireless Internet. It was a great price for the location and service. Close to all restaurants and boutique stores and directly on the beach, next to the pier. A lot of bums on the beach but none on the hotel grounds. Would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: Seahorse007
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a basic, no frills place near the ocean, this should do fine. I was a bit nervous after reading other postings telling of homeless sleeping in the doorways and the courtyard. I have to say there are a lot of homelss in the area, but none that I saw on hotel property. Still, there was an almost constant police "presence" just across the street by the beach. My room was partial ocean view on the third floor. Yes I could see the water, but one troubling thing is that the windows don't have any screens on them. I wanted to listen to the ocean as I went to sleep, but that would have meant leaving the windows wide open and they are big enough for someone to just slip right in. Needless to say, the windows stayed closed which was disppointing being so close to the ocean. Otherwise the room was neat & clean, and very basic. There was a decent sized refrigerator that looked almost new. My friend rented the "occeanfront" condo which is next door to the hotel. It's nice inside, but to get up the stairs we had to go past the beer swilling mob lingering outside the downstairs unit -- I'm not sure if they live there or if it's also a rental. They were friendly enough, but my friend was a bit unnerved by empty beer cans all over the entryway. The condo is a bit pricey, but the view of the beach is nice and we spent a lot of time just sitting there on the deck watching the surfers. Inside the condo was clean and neat. Ocean Beach is a busy little part of town with lots of shops and restaurants, and of course the beach. One thing we really liked was "Shades" restaurant, literally right next door to the hotel. Good food, good prices, and a nice view. it was packed on Sunday morning for breakfast! Bottom line: if you're looking for the Ritz, this ain't it. If you want clean and neat near the ocean without breaking the bank, give the OB Hotel a chance. I'd probably go back if I was in that area, but I wouldn't be heart broken if it was booked and I had to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: EGrattz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at OB Hotel only for a night but had no problems. I don't think it claims to be a fancy place in any way, but it is a great option. OB is certainly a very unpretentious place to be. The vibe in the town is very chill and the people friendly. There seems to be a crew of drunks adn addicts, but seem to stick to themselves. I just wouldn't be walking on the beach alone late at night. The hotel was clean and affordable. The room had a bit of a musty smell but that didn't bother me too much. I just needed a clean place to sleep. The only negative was how thin the walls were. I was up at 7:30am due to this because I could hear CLEARLY what my neighbours were saying. This is a great town to be in, I highly recommend experiencing this at least once in your life. It is a very cool surf town and I hope to go back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Fun location, but loud on weekends”
Reviews.Author: Guvvie
Reviews.Content: I love OB and have been there about 3 times before this trip. It's definitely not the ritziest part of town, and you should know that before staying here, but I think the OB Hotel is in a great location, lovely views of the beach and close to Newport Ave and lots of good restaurants. The staff was really friendly and helpful. I will say that in the two-three years since I had last been to OB, it seems to have gotten a bit raunchier. There were more drunks (and cops) on Newport than I remembered--but I never felt unsafe--and the OB Hotel itself was very loud every night I stayed there, especially at bar time, although I was there on a weekend. The rooms do smell a little musty and like disinfectant but overall I was happy with ours. We had a balcony room but our friends did not and their room felt a little cramped without it. One tip for staying in OB--hardly any restaurants seem to take credit cards, so make sure you have plenty of cash.

Reviews.Title: “Huge family reunion at the beach in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MikeYoga
Reviews.Content: 70 of us actually stayed at the Ocean Beach Hotel for a week in early July both in 2005 and 2006. 2005 was a family reunion and my "Big 60". Because I live in San Diego, I got to handle all the room reservations. We had family from 10 different states, from 1 year olds to 80 year olds (20 under 20). It was the perfect place for our family to stay. It has a big beautiful flower-filled courtyard where the youngest kids could play safely during the day and where we had big family dinners in the evening. And it is right on the beach, so the older kids/young adults could spend their days at the ocean. Everybody who came from out of state had all these plans to see the other San Diego sights, but once they settled in, they realized how wonder it was just to stay in Ocean Beach, enjoy the beach, go to the Farmers Market on Wednesday night, enjoy the shops and restaurants of Newport Avenue, and spend lots of quality time with their cousins, etc. from all over the western U.S. Another important feature of Ocean Beach, especially for young families- or big families, is that the restaurants are very reasonably priced, including the wonderful family restaurant on the pier. Breakfast and lunch were inexpensive and then we would order take-out and have big family dinners in the courtyard of the hotel, making our own salads and having our own sodas and beer and wine. More time to spend with family and friends and much more affordable for everybody. The staff at the Ocean Beach Hotel is friendly, courteous, and incredibly helpful. They went out of their way to help with whatever we needed. Little did we (or they) know that we would be back 50 weeks later. This year was the wedding of Katie (from San Diego) who teaches with now-her-husband Matt in Honolulu. They chose the Thursday Club in Sunset Cliffs for the wedding and the Ocean Beach Hotel was the overwhelming choice for everyone to stay after our wonderful experience in 2005. I, of course, was delegated to handle the room reservations again. There were hardly any of the younger children this year, but lots of Matt's family and friends from the Pittsburg, PA area. I emailed them the website, but had them make the room reservations through me. Once again, the hotel staff helped immensely. It was great to see the reactions of the Pittsburg visitors. They said " I know you said it was right on the beach, but it is really right on the beach!" Once again, they had all these plans to see all the San Diego sights and then hardly left Ocean Beach. A big thank you to the Ocean Beach Hotel for helping make the Hughes family gatherings so special- two years in a row! Mike Hughes, San Diego Pat Hughes, Casper, WY Don Hughes, San Diego Barb Sanford, Lewistown, MT Mary James, Denver, CO Debbie Eliason, Billings, MT Joe Hughes, Denver, CO Laurie Hughes, Fairfield, CA Aunts, cousins, nieces and nephews from MT, WY, CO, CA, MD, VA, IL, TX, HI, OR Matt's family and friends, Pittburg, Philly, FL

Reviews.Title: “My 8-year-old and I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: digit1966
Reviews.Content: OB is a fun community...the ocean was out my window yet we were at most attractions within 10 minutes. The streets are easily navigable with a good map. We shopped at the local Von's and AppleTree for necessities and snacks where the staff was very friendly and helpful as was the hotel, local restaurant and post office staff. The hotel courtyard was nice although I would prefer non-smoking there as well. Our stay was pleasant other than a few minutes one night when a new tenant became irate outside our window because she couldn't get the keycard to work. (Another tenant finally assisted.) The beach is family-friendly. Newport Avenue (the strip which ends with the hotel) is busy. There is a laid-back vibe, but watch your children closely. Do not develop a false sense of security. This site is good for families and singles alike who want to be more part of a community and less tourist.

Reviews.Title: “ob hotel should be on national list of shrines!”
Reviews.Author: mskitty4
Reviews.Content: i have been staying at the ob hotel for 30 years! it is a cute, funky hotel in the heart of bohemia sitting right on ocean beach in san diego. the hotel has recently been renovated. the rooms are small but more than adequate with a mini-frige for your happy hour supplies & a microwave. the rates are reasonable. you don't spend much time in the room when there is the beautiful pacific ocean at your feet. back to happy hour - all 24 hours are happy at the ob, the courtyard is lush with growth & a cozy spot to watch the sun set, drink a bottle of wine & meet your neighbors...& maybe even the owner, rich, who was kind enough to check in with us every evening. i think it was because we were such great company but could have been for the wine. either way, we enjoyed his company. he is so accomodating, he loaned us his personal boogey board for our 3 day stay. the atmosphere is festive & friendly. you can even tell your friends to watch you from the webcam posted on the hotel's roof. there is great shopping & restaurants all within walking distance. i wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when i go to san diego. truly, it should be on the national list of shrines. leanne van camp phoenix az

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront hotel on a dirty beach in a dirty town.”
Reviews.Author: gorounds30
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the OB Hotel for 3 nights. In fact that is the only time we were there...at night. We spent our entire vacation at any other beach in San Diego. This hotel is right on the beach just as advertised. The only problem is the beach is full of homeless (or what appear to be homeless people). The website boasts a small quaint beach community, which is far from reality. It is somewhere between a a transient stop and a biker town, and the restaurants are far from the advertised "world class." If you're looking for a cheap hotel in a shady town for a cheap price, stay here. We booked the queen with the balcony. The room was nice for the money, but make sure you get within two rooms of the beach, because none of the rooms actually have a balcony that faces the beach (they actually face the street and all it's inhabitants).

Reviews.Title: “40 and under....”
Reviews.Author: mhrunge
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a great location in Oean Beach. The beach itself is ok...I'm used to the large/clean/white sandy beaches of the Jersey shore (believe it or not!) Ocean Beach is a local beach town full of surfers and some seedy character....seemingly harmless. The pier is pretty cool, but a little seedy after sunset. The main street (Newport Ave.) has a bunch of casual restuarants and bars along with some surf shops....the bars get loud at night, but who cares if you are there! The room was ok, clean, but small. The a/c was right next to the bed so it blows directly on you. As far as the rest of San Diego, EVERYTHING is 10-15 minutes by car.....Coronado has the nicest beach in San Diego, by far. So, if you are, say, over 40...or have kids with you...not sure if this place is for you. If you are single with friends....or a couple, its a fun experience being in Ocean Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Beach Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The San Diego area has a great secret! A beach community with charm, beauty and a myriad of restaurants within walking distance. Being natives of San Diego, we wanted a beach community close to home, reasonably priced and with a relaxed atmosphere. Our expectations were exceeded with the Ocean Beach Hotel. Better than hoped for! Personable staff with a hands-on great owner, Rich Grosch. We were treated like honored guests. We had a beautiful ocean view which included the Ocean Beach pier, the beach itself with a lovely sunset. We parked the car and walked everyone for 2 days. Highly recommend the O.B. Motel to both locals and visitors.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of all the action. We knew that going in. The bars are loud, the partying goes late on Friday and Saturday, and there is constant foot traffic. However, it is right on the beach and all of the action is essentially beach action. We stayed at this hotes three years ago and swore we would never come back because the place was a rats hole and there just seemed to be a much larger homeless contingency. However, we heard that the hotel changed ownership (which was true) so we tried it again. The place was totally redone, clean, the people were nice - whereas before they were barely coherent - and the community has dramatically changed as far as cleanliness, police presence and absence of the homeless folks. Some other have said probably not great with kids. We agree. But if it's just you and your significant other this place is great

Reviews.Title: “great beach bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a weekend and found the OB Hotel to be the perfect place to chill out on the beach. Good price and great location - plenty of restaurants, cafes, bars and funky shops just off the doorstep. Beach is right across the street and taking a strolll down the pier with early a.m. coffee to watch surfers and fisherman is just a matter of crossing the road. Rooom is small but clean with prompt cleaning service. Great staff and free parking are a big plus. The bars can be a little noisy on the weekend but the scene was the attraction for us. If you're looking for a resorty, LaJolla type of spot, this isn't the place for you. But if you are looking for a relaxed, affordable stay in a place with some real character (Ocean Beach is really just a state of mind), the OB Hotel is right up your alley.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to Experience SD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel to stay at if you are looking to really experience the lifestyle that exists in OB. Don't expect the 4seasons, but the OB Hotel was nice nonetheless. Rooms were a bit small, we fit 2 easily, and even had 4 stay somewhat comfortably. But the rooms were very clean, and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. For a price of about $100/night I would definately do it again.

Reviews.Title: “quaint and charming”
Reviews.Author: tennischamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during spring break (3-13-2006 to 3-18-2006). If you are looking for a reasonable priced hotel on the beach, this is the one. We paid $127.00 per night, including tax for a ocean view room with a balcony. I would recommend getting a room on the top floor toward the front of the hotel. We had room #302 and had a good view of the ocean. Directly below is a street and parking lot. This hotel does not have any rooms with a direct view of the ocean with a balcony. We found the hotel to be dated, but well maintained. The bedroom and bathroom were fairly small, but it had a large shower. The room included a tv, tele-phone, small refrigator and microwave. Maid service was good and they did a through job of cleaning each day. Parking was free. There are numerous restaurants, shops and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Super deal, right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a relaxing time in San Diego at this hotel. We stayed there about a year or so ago and were thrilled to report it even better. The owner must be a professional gardner as the landscaping has matured and looks wonderful. The friendly desk knew what entertainment was going on in the area, which we enjoyed since it rained on Sat. Sunday was beautiful again. I'm not sure how they can possibly keep the rates so low in such an expensive area, but we love it and will return! The Custers, Albuquerque, N.M.

HotelInfo.Name: Ocean Beach Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5080 Newport Ave, San Diego, CA 92107
